message:
A very funny skit about SharePoint.  I actually agree with a few points. And learning Silverlight :), that was a big joke :)

"Javascript is for amateurs"
story: Mohamed Samy shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: SharePoint Apps
caption: youtube.com
description: The project manager for a SharePoint development team learns about SharePoint Apps.

data.message: lool I did IISReset be 3adada sha3r rasy back in 2007 :D
and front end web web dev?

stopped after sharepoint 2007 .. there was another joke in 2010 that was enumerating data in SPLists with web services and annoying references .. so that you don't write your application in the server itself .. damn  it .. I hate it and  I didn't continue after that :D
don't know about the new 2013 apps .. all  I know is that I need a laptop with 32 GB to play with it .. which I don't have .. and will not make such a grave mistake for Sharepoint :D
he doesn't mean that he valued front-end developers :D :D
After all these years we are reduced to running client side script
You can't Architect Javascript :)

hey :D .. don't be upset .. client side scripts are not bad .. I am just waiting for employing the GPU inside javascript .. and suddenly you will see that power will be taken from the cloud and get back to people with their tiny machines :D
So why not use Python? Why not execute Python ? why use a bad quality language when you can execute a well architected one with great syntax and amazing libraries
قضاء و قدر .. الجافا سكريبت كانت موجودة من الأول على كل البراوزرز  :D
yes, but now we can have python on android and on windows, Linux, mac
So we can consider it cross platform

unfortunately you are not among the key players of this industry :D .. have u ever heard about asm.js .. if not .. then rest assured .. there will be compilers that translate from major languages into javascript :D
of course I am, this is an MSamy prediction, get my autograph when it comes true :)
You are gonna love this video man Ayman El-Hattab
There are a number of tools to compile python to js

Mohammad Tayseer NO, Javascript must end, all it takes is to have the FF, Chrome access the Python interpreter, and that is a very small change, JS can still exist for a while, but once you have a choice, JS will die and we will all throw a party
"Any application that can be written in JavaScript, will eventually be written in JavaScript" - Atwood's Law

Mohamed Samy .. javascript won't be dead .. people have chosen javascript to survive ;) .. once you begin smoking it .. you will be addicted .. there is nothing more amusing than to mix lambdas with class definitions with the same syntax :D.
RIP Python :D :D long live my precious un-maintainable javascript components :D

In SharePoint Apps use your own language, if you want to play in SharePoint screens play with Microsoft roles :) = JavaScript!    You know what, they are removing the public sites from O365 because of the branding and the heavy customization which is = to a lot of support with no CALs ... check this http://www.rdacorp.com/2015/03/alternate-solution-alternate-css-url-sharepoint-2013-online/
Samy's law: Javascript will be eventually replaced by a more powerful cross platform language with better syntax and it will be an interpretted language not a compiled one
تراهن على كام ان  البيثون هتندثر زى الفورتران 77 و تبقى ذكرياااااااات   :D
History repeats it self in a very boring way..
Microsoft is using native code on their own platforms for a reason you know..
well .. I would say that assembly language is an interpreted language on the bare metal :D
